channel.title: Clicks when linking sequencers
channel.description: Hey I am trying to use the "sel/sel i 32" and link a few of them together to make a step LFO. In this example I use it to control the pitch of an oscillator. But I notice when the sequencers switch from one to the next there is a little glitch, which results in an audible click from the oscillator. Do I need to insert something in the chain to avoid those clicks? For example between "chain" and "in"? Or might this be a bug? I also tested with the "sel/sel i 32" and that also clicks when going from one sequencer to the next. LFO SYNCABLE II TRI2 FOR Com.axp (16.1 KB) @johannes @thetechnobear? [Uploading...]()

item.title: Clicks when linking sequencers
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

AHHH yes that helped... Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Clicks when linking sequencers
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Try chaining the "o" outlet into the "def" inlet of the next "sel" object, just like "chain"/"in".

Read full topic

item.title: Clicks when linking sequencers
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

Hey

I am trying to use the "sel/sel i 32" and link a few of them together to make a step LFO. In this example I use it to control the pitch of an oscillator.

But I notice when the sequencers switch from one to the next there is a little glitch, which results in an audible click from the oscillator.

Do I need to insert something in the chain to avoid those clicks? For example between "chain" and "in"?

Or might this be a bug? I also tested with the "sel/sel i 32" and that also clicks when going from one sequencer to the next.

LFO SYNCABLE II TRI2 FOR Com.axp (16.1 KB)

@johannes @thetechnobear?

clicks.png786x479 36.1 KB
Uploading...
